did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Daughters of Zelophehad (Chesterfield County, Va.) records, 1998-2014

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Daughters of Zelophehad (Chesterfield County, Va.) records, 1998-2014. Accession 53432. Organization records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift fo Paula Owens Parker, North Chesterfield, Virginia.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Daughters of Zelophehad (DOZ) was a nonprofit organization out of Chesterfield Virginia founded by Rev. Dr. Paula Owens Parker. DOZ was a transitional housing program for mothers and children in crisis which allowed a mother and her children to stay in the program and housed for up to 2 years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records, 1998-2014, of the Daughters of Zelophehad located in Chesterfield County, Virginia, containing documentation for the organization that highlights their efforts to help single mothers and their children through the organization's transitional housing program. Includes meeting minutes, correspondence, newspaper articles, and promotional materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in the following series:

scopecontent.p: Administration/Organizational Functions, contains documents on the organizational functions including meeting minutes and agendas, handbooks, financial documents, grant applications, and information on the Board and residents of the program.

did.unittitle: Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws16 January 2000
St. Barnabas and Dill House Program Handbook2009
Financial Statements and Independent Auditors Report31 December 2002
Thoughts on DOZ Remaining As Is

scopecontent.p: Correspondence contains a collection of emails, letters, invitations, and contracts with DOZ members and associates.

Board resolution to update bank account23 January 2006

scopecontent.p: Promotional materials contains materials to garner funds for the organization and distribute information on current affairs.

did.unittitle: Complete lists of low hanging fruit fundraising ideas16 February 2006

scopecontent.p: Curriculum contains educational resources for both staff and residents including prayers, guidebooks, workshops, and worksheets.

did.unittitle: Creating a Nurturing Environment-Amy J. Harris
Light of the World Prayer/Counseling Ministies
The Very Reverend Sandra (Sandi) B. Kerner

scopecontent.p: Programs and events contains information on DOZ programs and events held throughout the years including celebrations and fundraising events such as Chairs to Cherish, DOZ 10th Anniversary, and Coffee & Tea with the Daughters of Z.

did.unittitle: Coffee and Tea with the Daughters of Z27 September 2009

scopecontent.p: Media coverage Includes local media coverage of DOZ as well as other newspaper clippings stored by DOZ.

scopecontent.p: Photographs includes personal photos and photo CDs of DOZ families, houses, and events.

scopecontent.p: Community resources includes materials from various local community businesses and organizations.
Miscellaneous contains various CD-Roms, state government documents, and handwritten notes.
